definition: having both integrity and talent (idiom)
Germany/German/abbr. for 德國|德国[De2 guo2]
virtue/goodness/morality/ethics/kindness/favor/character/kind
ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now
double/twice/simultaneous/holding two or more (official) posts at the same time
to prepare/get ready/to provide or equip

sentences.english: We should choose state leaders for their talents and virtue.
sentences.chinese: 我們應該按照德才兼備的標準來挑選國家領導人。

sentences.english: This can become a good student ability and political integrity in the 21st century.
sentences.chinese: 這樣才能成爲一個21世紀德才兼備的好學生。

sentences.english: He also claims to select cadres under the principle "combining ability with political integrity, giving priority to morals".
sentences.chinese: 主張採取“德才兼備，以德爲主”的原則選拔幹部。
